00020 // Plan here is to generate an instance of a problem (or whatever you have)
00021 // and return that.

00323 #include <string>

00325 #include "MinionInputReader.h"
00326 
00327 template<typename FileReader>
00328 void MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::parser_info(string s)
00329 {
00330   if(parser_verbose)
00331     cout << s << endl;
00332 }
00333 
00334 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00335 // read
00336 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00337 template<typename FileReader>
00338 void MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::read(FileReader* infile) {  
00339   string s = infile->get_asciistring();
00340   parser_info("Read: '" + s + "'");
00341 
00342   string eof, wrong_eof;
00343 
00344   if(isGadgetReader())
00345   {
00346     eof = "**GADGET_END**";
00347     wrong_eof = "**EOF**";
00348   }
00349   else
00350   {
00351     eof = "**EOF**";
00352     wrong_eof = "**GADGET_END**";
00353   }
00354 
00355   while(s != eof)
00356   {
00357     if(s == "**VARIABLES**")
00358       readVars(infile);
00359     else if(s == "**SEARCH**")
00360       readSearch(infile);
00361     else if(s == "**TUPLELIST**")
00362       readTuples(infile);
00363     else if(s =="**CONSTRAINTS**")
00364     {
00365       while(infile->peek_char() != '*')
00366         instance.constraints.push_back(readConstraint(infile, false));
00367     }
00368     else if(s == "**GADGET**")
00369       { readGadget(infile); }
00370     else if(s == wrong_eof)
00371     { 
00372       throw parse_exception("Section terminated with " + wrong_eof + 
00373         " instead of " + eof);
00374     }
00375     else
00376       throw parse_exception("Don't understand '" + s + "' as a section header");
00377     s = infile->get_asciistring();
00378     parser_info("Read: '" + s + "'");
00379   }
00380 
00381   parser_info("Reached end of CSP");
00382 
00383   if(isGadgetReader() && instance.constructionSite.empty())
00384     throw parse_exception("Gadgets need a construction site!");
00385 
00386   // Fill in any missing defaults
00387   if(instance.search_order.empty())
00388   {
00389     parser_info("No order generated, auto-generating complete order");
00390     instance.search_order.push_back(instance.vars.get_all_vars());
00391   }
00392 
00393   for(int i = 0; i < instance.search_order.size(); ++i)
00394     instance.search_order[i].setupValueOrder();
00395 
00396   // This has to be delayed unless not all variables are defined where 'PRINT ALL' occurs.
00397   if(print_all_vars)
00398     instance.print_matrix = instance.all_vars_list;
00399     
00400   if(instance.sym_order.empty())
00401     instance.sym_order = instance.vars.get_all_vars();
00402     
00403   if(instance.sym_order.size() != instance.vars.get_all_vars().size())
00404   {
00405     parser_info("Extending symmetry order with auxillery variables");
00406     vector<Var> all_vars = instance.vars.get_all_vars();
00407     for(typename vector<Var>::iterator i = all_vars.begin(); i != all_vars.end(); ++i)
00408     {
00409       if(find(instance.sym_order.begin(), instance.sym_order.end(), *i) == instance.sym_order.end() )
00410         instance.sym_order.push_back(*i);
00411     }
00412   }
00413   
00414   if(instance.sym_order.size() != set<Var>(instance.sym_order.begin(), instance.sym_order.end()).size())
00415      throw parse_exception("SYMORDER cannot contain any variable more than once");
00416      
00417    if(instance.sym_order.size() != instance.vars.get_all_vars().size())
00418      throw parse_exception("SYMORDER must contain every variable");   
00419     
00420 }
00421 
00422 template<typename FileReader>
00423 void MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readGadget(FileReader* infile)
00424 {
00425   parser_info("Entering gadget parsing");
00426   if(isGadgetReader())
00427     throw parse_exception("Gadgets can't have gadgets!");
00428 
00429   infile->check_string("NAME");
00430   string name = infile->get_string();
00431   parser_info("Gadget name:" + name);
00432 
00433   MinionThreeInputReader gadget(parser_verbose);
00434   gadget.setGadgetReader();
00435   gadget.read(infile);
00436 
00437   // Take the CSPInstance out of the Minion3InputReader, and make a copy of it.
00438   instance.addGadgetSymbol(name, shared_ptr<CSPInstance>(new CSPInstance(MOVE(gadget.instance))));
00439   parser_info("Exiting gadget parsing");
00440 }
00441

00443 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00444 // readConstraint
00445 // Recognise constraint by its name, read past name and leading '('
00446 // Return false if eof or unknown ct. Else true.
00447 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00448 template<typename FileReader>
00449 ConstraintBlob MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraint(FileReader* infile, BOOL reified) {
00450   string id = infile->getline('(');
00451 
00452   int constraint_num = -1;
00453   for(int i = 0; i < num_of_constraints; ++i)
00454   {
00455     if(constraint_list[i].name == id)
00456     {
00457       constraint_num = i;
00458       break;
00459     }
00460   }
00461 
00462   if(constraint_num == -1) 
00463   {
00464     if (infile->eof()) 
00465     {
00466       throw parse_exception(string("Bad Constraint Name or reached end of file: '") + id + "'");
00467     }
00468     else
00469       { throw parse_exception(string("Unknown Constraint:") + id); }
00470   }
00471   ConstraintDef* constraint = constraint_list + constraint_num;
00472 
00473   switch(constraint->type)
00474   {
00475 #ifdef CT_WATCHED_OR_ABC
00476     case CT_WATCHED_OR:
00477     return readConstraintOr(infile, get_constraint(CT_WATCHED_OR));
00478     break;
00479 #endif
00480 
00481 #ifdef CT_GADGET_ABC
00482     case CT_GADGET:
00483     return readConstraintGadget(infile);
00484     break;
00485 #endif
00486 
00487 #ifdef CT_WATCHED_TABLE_ABC
00488     case CT_WATCHED_TABLE:
00489 #endif
00490 #ifdef CT_WATCHED_NEGATIVE_TABLE_ABC
00491     case CT_WATCHED_NEGATIVE_TABLE:
00492 #endif
00493     return readConstraintTable(infile, constraint);
00494     break;
00495 
00496     default:
00497     return readGeneralConstraint(infile, constraint);
00498   }
00499   // g++ seems to think compilation can get here. I disagree, but putting a catch doesn't hurt.
00500   throw parse_exception("Fatal error in parsing constraints");
00501 }
00502 
00503 template<typename FileReader>
00504 ConstraintBlob MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraintTable(FileReader* infile, ConstraintDef* def)
00505 {
00506   ConstraintBlob con(def);
00507   
00508   con.vars.push_back(readLiteralVector(infile));
00509   infile->check_sym(',');
00510   con.tuples = readConstraintTupleList(infile);
00511   infile->check_sym(')');
00512   
00513   if(con.vars[0].size() != con.tuples->tuple_size())
00514   {
00515     throw parse_exception("Tuple constraint with " + to_string(con.vars[0].size()) + 
00516                           " variables cannot have tuples of length " + to_string(con.tuples->tuple_size()));
00517   }
00518   
00519   if(con.vars[0].size() == 0)
00520   {
00521 #if defined(CT_TRUE_ABC) && defined(CT_FALSE_ABC)
00522     // Either trivially true, or trivially false, depending on how many tuples there are.
00523     if(con.tuples->size() != 0)
00524       return ConstraintBlob(get_constraint(CT_TRUE));
00525     else
00526       return ConstraintBlob(get_constraint(CT_FALSE));
00527 #else
00528     throw parse_exception("Need the 'true' and 'false' constraints enable for empty table constraints!");
00529 #endif
00530   }  
00531   
00532   return con;
00533 }
00534 
00535 template<typename FileReader>
00536 ConstraintBlob MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readGeneralConstraint(FileReader* infile, ConstraintDef* def)
00537 {
00538   // This slightly strange code is to save copying the ConstraintBlob as much as possible.
00539   ConstraintBlob con(def);
00540   vector<vector<Var> >& varsblob = con.vars;
00541   vector<vector<int> >& constblob = con.constants;
00542 
00543   for(int i = 0; i < def->number_of_params; ++i)
00544   {
00545     switch(def->read_types[i])
00546     {
00547       case read_list:
00548       varsblob.push_back(readLiteralVector(infile));
00549       break;
00550       case read_var:
00551       varsblob.push_back(make_vec(readIdentifier(infile)));
00552       break;
00553       case read_bool_var:
00554       varsblob.push_back(make_vec(readIdentifier(infile)));
00555       if(varsblob.back().back().type() != VAR_BOOL)
00556         throw parse_exception("Expected Boolean variable!");
00557       break;
00558       case read_2_vars:
00559       {
00560         vector<Var> vars(2);
00561         vars[0] = readIdentifier(infile);
00562         infile->check_sym(',');
00563         vars[1] = readIdentifier(infile);
00564         varsblob.push_back(MOVE(vars));
00565       }
00566       break;
00567       case read_constant:
00568       constblob.push_back(make_vec(infile->read_num()));
00569       break;
00570       case read_constant_list:
00571       {
00572         vector<Var> vectorOfConst = readLiteralVector(infile);
00573         vector<int> vals;
00574           for(unsigned int loop = 0; loop < vectorOfConst.size(); ++loop)
00575           {
00576             if(vectorOfConst[loop].type() != VAR_CONSTANT)
00577                 throw parse_exception("Vector must only contain constants.");
00578               else
00579           vals.push_back(vectorOfConst[loop].pos());
00580           }
00581           constblob.push_back(MOVE(vals));
00582       }
00583       break;  
00584       case read_constraint:
00585       con.internal_constraints.push_back(readConstraint(infile, false));
00586       break;
00587       case read_constraint_list:
00588       con.internal_constraints = readConstraintList(infile);
00589       break;
00590       case read_tuples:
00591       con.tuples = readConstraintTupleList(infile);
00592       break;
00593       default:
00594       D_FATAL_ERROR("Internal Error!");
00595     }
00596     if(i != def->number_of_params - 1)
00597       infile->check_sym(',');
00598   }
00599   infile->check_sym(')');
00600   
00601   return con;
00602 }
00603 
00604 template<typename FileReader>
00605 TupleList* MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraintTupleList(FileReader* infile)
00606 {
00607   TupleList* tuplelist;
00608   
00609   if(infile->peek_char() != '{')
00610   {
00611     string name = infile->get_string();
00612     tuplelist = instance.getTableSymbol(name);
00613   }
00614   else
00615   {
00616     vector<vector<int> > tuples ;
00617     infile->check_sym('{');
00618     char delim = infile->peek_char();
00619     
00620     int tupleSize = 0;
00621     
00622     while (delim != '}') 
00623     {
00624       infile->check_sym('<');
00625       vector<int> tuple;
00626       // Optimisation
00627       tuple.reserve(tupleSize);
00628       
00629       char next_char = ',';
00630       while(next_char == ',')
00631       {
00632         tuple.push_back(infile->read_num());
00633         next_char = infile->get_char();
00634       }
00635       if(next_char != '>')
00636         throw parse_exception("Expected ',' or '>'");
00637       
00638       if(tupleSize == 0)
00639         tupleSize = tuple.size();
00640       if(tupleSize != tuple.size())
00641         throw parse_exception("All tuples in each constraint must be the same size!");
00642       tuples.push_back(MOVE(tuple)) ;
00643 
00644       delim = infile->get_char();                          // ',' or '}'
00645       if(delim != ',' && delim!= '}')
00646         throw parse_exception("Expected ',' or '}'");
00647     }
00648     tuplelist = instance.tupleListContainer->getNewTupleList(tuples);
00649     instance.addUnnamedTableSymbol(tuplelist);
00650   }
00651   
00652   return tuplelist;
00653 }
00654 
00655 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00656 // readConstraintGadget
00657 // table(<vectorOfVars>, {<tuple> [, <tuple>]})
00658 // Tuples represented as a vector of int arrays.
00659 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00660 #ifdef CT_GADGET_ABC
00661 template<typename FileReader>
00662 ConstraintBlob MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraintGadget(FileReader* infile) 
00663 {
00664   parser_info( "Reading a gadget constraint" ) ;
00665 
00666   vector<Var> vectorOfVars = readLiteralVector(infile) ;
00667 
00668   infile->check_sym(',');
00669 
00670   string s = infile->get_string();
00671 
00672   parser_info( "Gadget name: '" + s + "'");
00673   shared_ptr<CSPInstance> in_gadget = instance.getGadgetSymbol(s);
00674   ConstraintBlob gadgetCon( get_constraint(CT_GADGET) , vectorOfVars);
00675   gadgetCon.gadget = in_gadget;
00676   infile->check_sym(',');
00677   gadgetCon.gadget_prop_type = GetPropMethodFromString(infile->get_string());
00678   infile->check_sym(')');
00679   parser_info("End gadget reading");
00680   return gadgetCon;
00681 }
00682 #endif
00683 
00684 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00685 // readConstraintOr
00686 // or(<vectorOfVars>)
00687 // SAT clauses represented as literals and negated literals
00688 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00689 template<typename FileReader>
00690 ConstraintBlob MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraintOr(FileReader* infile, 
00691   ConstraintDef* ct)
00692 {
00693   parser_info("Reading a SAT clause");
00694   infile->check_sym('[');
00695   vector<int> negs;
00696   vector<Var> clause_vars;
00697   if(infile->peek_char() != ']')
00698     clause_vars.push_back(readIdentifier(infile));
00699   while(infile->peek_char() != ']') {
00700     infile->check_sym(',');
00701     clause_vars.push_back(readIdentifier(infile));
00702   }
00703   infile->check_sym(']');
00704   infile->check_sym(')');
00705   for(int i = 0; i < clause_vars.size(); i++) {
00706     if(clause_vars[i].type() == VAR_NOTBOOL) {
00707       negs.push_back(0);
00708       clause_vars[i].setType(VAR_BOOL);
00709     } else {
00710       negs.push_back(1);
00711     }
00712   }
00713   ConstraintBlob cb(ct, clause_vars);
00714   cb.negs = negs;
00715   return cb;
00716 }
00717 
00719 template<typename FileReader>
00720 Var MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readIdentifier(FileReader* infile) {
00721   char idChar = infile->peek_char();
00722 
00723   if ((('0' <= idChar) && ('9' >= idChar)) || idChar == '-') {
00724     int i = infile->read_num();
00725     return Var(VAR_CONSTANT, i);
00726   }
00727   bool negVar = false;
00728   // Check to see if this is a negated Boolean
00729   if(infile->peek_char() == '!')
00730   {
00731     negVar = true;
00732     infile->get_char();
00733   }
00734 
00735   string name = infile->get_string();
00736   Var var = instance.vars.getSymbol(name);
00737   if(var.type() == VAR_MATRIX)
00738   {
00739     vector<int> params = readConstantVector(infile);
00740     vector<int> max_index = instance.vars.getMatrixSymbol(name);
00741     if(params.size() != max_index.size())
00742       throw parse_exception("Can't index a " + to_string(max_index.size()) + 
00743       "-d matrix with " + to_string(params.size()) +
00744       " indices.");
00745     for(int i = 0; i < params.size(); ++i)
00746     {
00747       if(params[i] < 0 || params[i] >= max_index[i])
00748         throw parse_exception(to_string(i) + string("th index is out of bounds,") + 
00749         to_string(params[i]) + " is not between 0 and " +
00750         to_string(max_index[i] - 1));
00751     }
00752     name += to_var_name(params);
00753     var = instance.vars.getSymbol(name);
00754   }
00755 
00756   if(negVar)
00757   {
00758     if(var.type() != VAR_BOOL)
00759       parser_info("Only Booleans can be negated!");
00760     else
00761       var.setType(VAR_NOTBOOL);
00762   }
00763 
00764   parser_info("Read variable '" + name + "', internally: " + to_string(var));
00765   return var;
00766 }
00767 
00768 // This function reads an identifier which might be a single variable,
00769 // which includes a fully derefenced matrix, or might be a partially or
00770 // not-at-all dereferenced matrix. It could also just be a number!
00771 // The code shares a lot with readIdentifier, and at some point the two
00772 // should probably merge
00773 template<typename FileReader>
00774 vector<Var> MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readPossibleMatrixIdentifier(FileReader* infile, bool mustBeMatrix) {
00775   char idChar = infile->peek_char();
00776 
00777   vector<Var> returnVec;
00778 
00779   if ((('0' <= idChar) && ('9' >= idChar)) || idChar == '-') {
00780     if(mustBeMatrix)
00781       throw parse_exception("Must be matrix here, not constant");
00782     int i = infile->read_num();
00783     returnVec.push_back(Var(VAR_CONSTANT, i));
00784     return returnVec;
00785   }
00786 
00787   bool negVar = false;
00788   // Check to see if this is a negated Boolean
00789   if(infile->peek_char() == '!')
00790   {
00791     negVar = true;
00792   // Swallow the '!'
00793     infile->get_char();
00794   }
00795 
00796   // Get name of variable.
00797   string name = infile->get_string();
00798 
00799   Var var = instance.vars.getSymbol(name);
00800 
00801   if(var.type() == VAR_MATRIX)
00802   {
00803     vector<int> params;
00804     if(infile->peek_char() == '[')
00805     {
00806       params = readConstantVector(infile,'[',']',true);
00807       returnVec = instance.vars.buildVarList(name, params);
00808       if(negVar)
00809       {
00810           if(returnVec.size()!=1)
00811           {
00812               throw parse_exception("Sorry, can't negate a matrix");
00813           }
00814           if(returnVec[0].type()!=VAR_BOOL)
00815           {
00816               throw parse_exception("Sorry, can't negate a non-Boolean variable");
00817           }
00818           returnVec[0].setType(VAR_NOTBOOL); 
00819           // The clever thing to do would be to change type of all of returnVec at the end of the function, if necessary. 
00820       }
00821     }
00822     else
00823       { // build a vector of all 'nulls'
00824       if(negVar)
00825         throw parse_exception("Sorry, can't negate a matrix");
00826     
00827       vector<int> maxterms = instance.vars.getMatrixSymbol(name);
00828     params = vector<int>(maxterms.size(), -999);
00829     returnVec = instance.vars.buildVarList(name, params);
00830   }
00831   parser_info("Got matrix:" + to_string(returnVec));
00832 }
00833 else
00834 { 
00835   if(mustBeMatrix)
00836     throw parse_exception("Must give matrix here, not single variable!");
00837   if(negVar)
00838   {
00839     if(var.type() != VAR_BOOL)
00840       parser_info("Only Booleans can be negated!");
00841     else
00842       var.setType(VAR_NOTBOOL);
00843   }
00844   returnVec.push_back(var);
00845 }
00846 parser_info("Read variable '" + name + "', internally: " + to_string(var));
00847 return returnVec;  
00848 }
00849 
00850 template<typename FileReader>
00851 vector<ConstraintBlob> MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraintList(FileReader* infile) {
00852   vector<ConstraintBlob> conlist;
00853   
00854   infile->check_sym('{');
00855   conlist.push_back(readConstraint(infile));
00856   
00857   char delim = infile->get_char();
00858   while(delim != '}')
00859   {
00860     if(delim != ',')
00861       throw parse_exception(string("Expected '}' or ',' , confused by '") + delim + string("'"));
00862     conlist.push_back(readConstraint(infile));
00863     delim = infile->get_char();
00864   }
00865   return conlist;
00866 }
00867 
00872 template<typename FileReader>
00873 vector<Var> MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readLiteralVector(FileReader* infile) {
00874   vector<Var> newVector;
00875 
00876   if(infile->peek_char() != '[')
00877   { // Must just be a matrix identifier
00878     return readPossibleMatrixIdentifier(infile, true);
00879   }
00880 
00881   infile->check_sym('[');
00882 
00883   // Delim here might end up being "x" or something similar. The reason
00884   // that we peek it is in case whis is an empty vector.
00885 
00886   char delim = infile->peek_char();
00887 
00888   if(delim == ']')
00889   {
00890   // Eat the ']'
00891     infile->get_char();
00892     parser_info("Read empty vector.");
00893   }
00894   else
00895   {
00896     while (delim != ']') {
00897       vector<Var> v = readPossibleMatrixIdentifier(infile);
00898       newVector.insert(newVector.end(), v.begin(), v.end());
00899       delim = infile->get_char();
00900       if(delim != ',' && delim != ']')
00901       {
00902   // replace X with the character we got.
00903         string s = "Expected ',' or ']'. Got 'X'.";
00904         s[s.size() - 3] = delim;
00905         throw parse_exception(s);
00906       }
00907       
00908       if(delim == ',' && infile->peek_char() == ']')
00909         delim = infile->get_char();
00910     }
00911   }
00912   return newVector;
00913 }
00914 
00915 
00916 template<typename FileReader>
00917 vector<vector<Var> > MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::read2DMatrix(FileReader* infile)
00918 {
00919   vector<vector<Var> > return_vals; 
00920 
00921   if(infile->peek_char() != '[')
00922     return read2DMatrixVariable(infile);
00923 
00924   infile->check_sym('[');
00925 
00926   while(infile->peek_char() != ']')
00927   {
00928     parser_info("Continuing reading matrix, peeked at " + to_string(']'));
00929     // See if there is an array, or just a variable.
00930     if(infile->peek_char() == '[') 
00931       return_vals.push_back(readLiteralVector(infile));
00932     else
00933     {
00934       vector<vector<Var> > vars = read2DMatrixVariable(infile);
00935       for(int i = 0; i < vars.size(); ++i)
00936         return_vals.push_back(vars[i]);
00937     }
00938     // Eat a comma if there is one there.
00939     if(infile->peek_char() == ',')
00940       infile->check_sym(',');
00941   }
00942 
00943   infile->check_sym(']');
00944   return return_vals;
00945 }
00946 
00947 // This function reads the next identifier, which should be a 1D or 2D matrix,
00948 // and returns it (if it was 1D, it returns it as a 1 row 2D matrix.
00949 template<typename FileReader>
00950 vector<vector<Var> > MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::read2DMatrixVariable(FileReader* infile) {
00951   string name = infile->get_string();
00952   Var var = instance.vars.getSymbol(name);
00953   // Check it is a matrix
00954   if(var.type() != VAR_MATRIX)
00955     throw parse_exception("Expected matrix");
00956   // Get dimension of matrix.
00957   vector<int> indices = instance.vars.getMatrixSymbol(name);
00958   // Make sure the matrix doesn't have an index after it. This is to produce better error messages.
00959   if(infile->peek_char() != ',' && infile->peek_char() != ']')
00960     throw parse_exception("Only accept raw matrix names here, expected ',' next.");
00961 
00962   if(indices.size() == 1)
00963   {
00964     vector<int> terms;
00965     terms.push_back(-999);
00966     // Use the existing code to flatten a matrix.
00967     // make_vec takes a T and turns it into a 1 element vector<T>.
00968     return make_vec(instance.vars.buildVarList(name, terms));
00969   }
00970   else
00971   {
00972     return instance.vars.flattenTo2DMatrix(name);
00973   }
00974 }
00975 
00976 // Note: allowNulls maps '_' to -999 (a horrible hack I know).
00977 // That last parameter defaults to false.
00978 // The start and end default to '[' and ']'
00979 template<typename FileReader>
00980 vector<int> MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readConstantVector
00981   (FileReader* infile, char start, char end, bool allowNulls) 
00982 {
00983   vector<int> newVector;
00984   infile->check_sym(start);
00985 
00986   // The reason we peek here is in case this is an empty vector
00987   char delim = infile->peek_char();
00988 
00989   if(delim == end)
00990   {
00991     // Eat the ']'
00992     infile->get_char();
00993     parser_info("Read empty vector.");
00994   }
00995   else
00996   {
00997     while (delim != end) 
00998     {
00999       if(allowNulls && infile->peek_char() == '_')
01000       {
01001         infile->get_char();
01002         newVector.push_back(-999);
01003       }
01004       else
01005         newVector.push_back(infile->read_num()) ;
01006       delim = infile->get_char();
01007       if(delim != ',' && delim != end)
01008         throw parse_exception(string("Expect ',' or ") + end + string("'. Got '") +
01009         delim + string("'"));
01010     }
01011   }
01012   return newVector;
01013 }
01014 
01016 template<typename FileReader>
01017 vector<int> MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readRange(FileReader* infile) 
01018 {
01019   vector<int> newVector;
01020   infile->check_sym('{');
01021 
01022   newVector.push_back(infile->read_num());
01023   infile->check_sym('.');
01024   infile->check_sym('.');
01025 
01026   newVector.push_back(infile->read_num());
01027 
01028   infile->check_sym('}');
01029   return newVector;
01030 }
01031 
01032 
01034 template<typename FileReader>
01035 void MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readTuples(FileReader* infile)
01036 {
01037   while(infile->peek_char() != '*')
01038   {
01039     string name = infile->get_string();
01040     int num_of_tuples = infile->read_num();
01041     int tuple_length = infile->read_num();
01042     parser_info("Reading tuplelist '" + name + "', length " + to_string(num_of_tuples) +
01043       ", arity " + to_string(tuple_length) );
01044     TupleList* tuplelist = instance.tupleListContainer->getNewTupleList(num_of_tuples, tuple_length);
01045     int* tuple_ptr = tuplelist->getPointer();
01046     for(int i = 0; i < num_of_tuples; ++i)
01047       for(int j = 0; j < tuple_length; ++j)
01048     {
01049       tuple_ptr[i * tuple_length + j] = infile->read_num();
01050     }
01051     tuplelist->finalise_tuples();
01052     instance.addTableSymbol(name, tuplelist);
01053   }
01054 
01055 }
01056 
01057 template<typename FileReader>
01058 void MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readSearch(FileReader* infile) {  
01059   while(infile->peek_char() != '*')
01060   {
01061     string var_type = infile->get_string();
01062 
01063     if(var_type == "VARORDER")
01064     {
01065       VarOrderEnum vo = ORDER_ORIGINAL;
01066       bool find_one_sol = false;
01067       
01068       if(infile->peek_char() == 'A')
01069       {
01070         string s = infile->get_string();
01071         if(s != "AUX")
01072           throw parse_exception("I do not understand " + s);
01073         find_one_sol = true;
01074       }
01075         
01076       if(infile->peek_char() != '[')
01077       {
01078         string s = infile->get_string();
01079 #define Z(x) if(s == #x) { vo = ORDER_##x; goto found; }
01080 Z(STATIC) Z(SDF) Z(SRF) Z(LDF) Z(ORIGINAL) Z(WDEG) Z(CONFLICT) Z(DOMOVERWDEG)
01081 #undef Z        
01082 throw parse_exception("Don't understand '" + s + "'");
01083 found: ;
01084       }
01085       
01086       instance.search_order.push_back(SearchOrder(readLiteralVector(infile), vo, find_one_sol));
01087       parser_info("Read var order, length " +
01088         to_string(instance.search_order.back().var_order.size()));
01089     }
01090     else if(var_type == "PERMUTATION")
01091     {
01092       if(!instance.permutation.empty())
01093         throw parse_exception("Can't have two PERMUTATIONs!");
01094       instance.permutation = readLiteralVector(infile);
01095       parser_info("Read permutation, length " +
01096         to_string(instance.permutation.size()));      
01097     }
01098     else if(var_type == "SYMORDER")
01099     {
01100       if(!instance.sym_order.empty())
01101         throw parse_exception("Can't have two SYMORDERs!");
01102       instance.sym_order = readLiteralVector(infile);
01103       parser_info("Read Symmetry Ordering, length " +
01104         to_string(instance.permutation.size()));      
01105     }
01106     else if(var_type == "VALORDER")
01107     {
01108       if(instance.search_order.empty())
01109         throw parse_exception("Must declare VARORDER first");
01110       if(!instance.search_order.back().val_order.empty())
01111         throw parse_exception("Can't have two VALORDERs for a VARORDER");
01112       vector<char> valOrder ;
01113 
01114       infile->check_sym('[');
01115 
01116       char delim = infile->peek_char();
01117 
01118       while (delim != ']') {
01119         char valOrderIdentifier = infile->get_char();
01120         if(valOrderIdentifier != 'a' && valOrderIdentifier != 'd')
01121           throw parse_exception("Expected 'a' or 'd'");
01122         valOrder.push_back(valOrderIdentifier == 'a');
01123         delim = infile->get_char();                                 // , or ]
01124       }
01125       instance.search_order.back().val_order = valOrder;
01126 
01127       parser_info("Read val order, length " +
01128           to_string(instance.search_order.back().val_order.size()));
01129     }
01130     else if(var_type == "MAXIMISING" || var_type == "MAXIMIZING")
01131     {
01132       if(instance.is_optimisation_problem == true)
01133         throw parse_exception("Can only have one min / max per problem!");
01134 
01135       Var var = readIdentifier(infile);
01136       parser_info("Maximising " + to_string(var));
01137       instance.set_optimise(false, var);
01138     }
01139     else if(var_type == "MINIMISING" || var_type == "MINIMIZING")
01140     {
01141       if(instance.is_optimisation_problem == true)
01142         throw parse_exception("Can only have one min / max per problem!");
01143 
01144       Var var = readIdentifier(infile);
01145       parser_info("Minimising " + to_string(var));
01146       instance.set_optimise(true, var);
01147     }
01148     else if(var_type == "PRINT")
01149     {
01150       if(infile->peek_char() == 'A')
01151       {
01152         string in = infile->get_string();
01153         if(in != "ALL")
01154           throw parse_exception("Don't understand '"+in+"'. Do you mean 'ALL'?");
01155         print_all_vars = true;
01156       }
01157       else if(infile->peek_char() == 'N')
01158       {
01159         string in = infile->get_string();
01160         if(in != "NONE")
01161           throw parse_exception("Don't understand '"+in+"'. Do you mean 'NONE'?");
01162         print_all_vars = false;
01163       }
01164       else
01165       {
01166         print_all_vars = false;
01167         vector<vector<Var> > new_matrix = read2DMatrix(infile);
01168         for(int i = 0; i < new_matrix.size(); ++i)
01169           instance.print_matrix.push_back(new_matrix[i]);
01170       }
01171     }
01172     else if(var_type == "CONSTRUCTION")
01173     {
01174       if(!isGadgetReader())
01175         throw parse_exception("Only have construction sites on gadgets!");
01176 
01177       instance.constructionSite = readLiteralVector(infile);
01178       parser_info("Read construction site, size " + to_string(instance.constructionSite.size()));
01179     }
01180     else
01181       {  throw parse_exception("Don't understand '" + var_type + "' as a variable type."); }
01182   }
01183 }
01184 
01185 
01186 template<typename FileReader>
01187 void MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readAliasMatrix(FileReader* infile, const vector<int>& max_indices, vector<int> indices, string name)
01188 {
01189   if(infile->peek_char() == '[')
01190   {
01191     infile->check_sym('[');
01192     // Have another level of reading to do..
01193     indices.push_back(0);
01194     readAliasMatrix(infile, max_indices, indices, name);
01195     infile->check_sym(']');
01196     while(infile->peek_char() == ',')
01197     {
01198       infile->check_sym(',');
01199       indices.back()++;
01200       infile->check_sym('[');
01201       readAliasMatrix(infile, max_indices, indices, name);
01202       infile->check_sym(']');
01203     }
01204     if(indices.back() + 1 != max_indices[indices.size() - 1])
01205       throw parse_exception("Incorrectly sized matrix!, expected index " +
01206       to_string(indices.size() - 1) + " to have " + to_string(max_indices[indices.size() - 1]) +
01207       " terms, got " + to_string(indices.back() + 1));
01208   }
01209   else
01210   {
01211     // Have reached the bottom level!
01212     indices.push_back(0);
01213     Var v = readIdentifier(infile);
01214     instance.vars.addSymbol(name + to_var_name(indices), v);
01215     while(infile->peek_char() == ',')
01216     {
01217       infile->check_sym(',');
01218       indices.back()++;
01219       Var v = readIdentifier(infile);
01220       instance.vars.addSymbol(name + to_var_name(indices), v);
01221     }
01222     if(indices.back() + 1 != max_indices[indices.size() - 1])
01223       throw parse_exception("Incorrectly sized matrix!, expected index " +
01224       to_string(indices.size() - 1) + " to have " + to_string(max_indices[indices.size() - 1]) +
01225       " terms, got " + to_string(indices.back() + 1));
01226   }
01227 }
01228 
01229 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
01230 template<typename FileReader>
01231 void MinionThreeInputReader<FileReader>::readVars(FileReader* infile) {
01232   while(infile->peek_char() != '*')
01233   {
01234     parser_info("Begin reading variables");
01235     string var_type = infile->get_string();
01236 
01237     if(var_type != "BOOL" && var_type != "BOUND" && var_type != "SPARSEBOUND"
01238       && var_type != "DISCRETE" && var_type != "ALIAS")
01239       throw parse_exception(string("Unknown variable type: '") + var_type + "'");
01240 
01241     string varname = infile->get_string();
01242     parser_info("Name:" + varname);
01243 
01244     bool isArray = false;
01245     vector<int> indices;
01246 
01247     if(infile->peek_char() == '[')
01248     {
01249       parser_info("Is array!");
01250       isArray = true;
01251       indices = readConstantVector(infile);
01252       parser_info("Found " + to_string(indices.size()) + " indices");
01253     }
01254 
01255     VariableType variable_type = VAR_INVALID;
01256     vector<int> domain;
01257 
01258     if(var_type == "ALIAS")
01259     {
01260       if(isArray == false)
01261       {
01262         infile->check_sym('='); // XYZ
01263         Var v = readIdentifier(infile);
01264         instance.vars.addSymbol(varname, v);
01265       }
01266       else
01267       {
01268         instance.vars.addMatrixSymbol(varname, indices);
01269         infile->check_sym('=');
01270         infile->check_sym('[');
01271         readAliasMatrix(infile, indices, vector<int>(), varname);
01272         infile->check_sym(']');
01273       }
01274     }
01275     else if(var_type == "BOOL")
01276     {
01277       variable_type = VAR_BOOL;
01278     }
01279     else if(var_type == "BOUND")
01280     {
01281       variable_type = VAR_BOUND;
01282       domain = readRange(infile);
01283       if(domain.size() != 2)
01284         throw parse_exception("Ranges contain 2 numbers!");
01285     }
01286     else if(var_type == "DISCRETE")
01287     {
01288       variable_type = VAR_DISCRETE;
01289       domain = readRange(infile);
01290       if(domain.size() != 2)
01291         throw parse_exception("Ranges contain 2 numbers!");
01292     }
01293     else if(var_type == "SPARSEBOUND")
01294     {
01295       variable_type = VAR_SPARSEBOUND;
01296       domain = readConstantVector(infile, '{', '}');
01297       if(domain.size() < 1)
01298         throw parse_exception("Don't accept empty domains!");
01299     }
01300     else
01301       throw parse_exception("I don't know about var_type '" + var_type + "'");
01302 
01303     if(var_type != "ALIAS")
01304     {
01305       if(isArray)
01306       {
01307         // If any index is 0, don't add any variables.
01308         if(find(indices.begin(), indices.end(), 0) == indices.end())
01309         {
01310           instance.vars.addMatrixSymbol(varname, indices);
01311           vector<int> current_index(indices.size(), 0);
01312           parser_info("New Var: " + varname + to_var_name(current_index));
01313           instance.vars.addSymbol(varname + to_var_name(current_index),
01314             instance.vars.getNewVar(variable_type, domain));
01315           while(increment_vector(current_index, indices))
01316           {
01317             parser_info("New Var: " + varname + to_var_name(current_index));
01318             instance.vars.addSymbol(varname + to_var_name(current_index),
01319               instance.vars.getNewVar(variable_type, domain));
01320           }
01321 
01322           vector<vector<Var> > matrix_list = instance.vars.flattenTo2DMatrix(varname);
01323           for(int i = 0; i < matrix_list.size(); ++i)
01324             instance.all_vars_list.push_back(matrix_list[i]);
01325         }
01326       }
01327       else
01328       {
01329         Var v = instance.vars.getNewVar(variable_type, domain);
01330         instance.vars.addSymbol(varname, v);
01331         instance.all_vars_list.push_back(make_vec(v));
01332       }
01333     }
01334   }
01335 
01336 }
